questions.question: Mr. Brown is conducting research to assess the impact of a new reading program in elementary schools across the county. Which of the following approaches should Mr. Brown take to ensure a valid conclusion?
options: Survey all teachers in the largest elementary school.
Survey one teacher from each grade across all schools.
Survey a random selection of teachers from each school in the county.
Survey all teachers who have been teaching for more than 10 years.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: C because selecting a random sample from each school allows for a diverse and representative sample of the entire population of teachers, increasing the likelihood of valid results.

questions.question: A research team wants to estimate the amount of time teenagers spend on social media per day. Which of the following sampling strategies is most appropriate?
options: Asking teenagers found in a local mall on a Saturday.
Gathering data from the social media accounts of the research team's family members.
Surveying a group of students from one technology class.
Using a stratified random sample of teenagers from different high schools and age groups.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: D because a stratified random sample ensures that subgroups within the population (high schools and age groups) are fairly represented, reducing potential bias.

questions.question: A company wishes to evaluate the job satisfaction level of its employees in different departments. What sampling strategy should the company use to gather the most accurate data?
options: Select the first 30 employees who arrive at work for the survey.
Send out a survey to all employees via email and use the first 100 responses.
Use a systematic sampling method to choose every 10th employee from the company directory.
Conduct a stratified random sample based on the departments and job positions within the company.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: D because stratified random sampling ensures representation across all departments and job positions, allowing for more accurate assessment of job satisfaction across the company.

questions.question: To determine the average sale value per customer in a retail store, which of the following would yield the most reliable estimate?
options: Calculating the mean sale value from Black Friday sales.
Calculating the mean sale value for all customers during a normal business week.
Using the median sale value of all customers in the past year.
Taking the average sale value of the top 100 customers from the last quarter.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: B because calculating the mean from a typical business week minimizes the influence of peak sales periods and outliers, offering a more representative average.

questions.question: An environmental agency wants to measure the average daily water usage of households in a city. Which of the following techniques will most likely lead to an accurate estimate?
options: Measuring the water usage in households of the agency's employees.
Measuring water usage from random households throughout the city on Saturdays.
Collecting water usage data from a different neighborhood each day, randomly selected.
Taking the water usage readings from the most affluent neighborhoods and extrapolating data for the whole city.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: C because by collecting data from randomly selected neighborhoods on different days, the agency will acquire a diverse and representative sample of the city's water usage patterns.

questions.question: The town mayor wants to estimate the proportion of town residents who are in favor of a new public transportation initiative. The most effective survey strategy would be to:
options: Ask each member of the town council for their opinion on the matter.
Conduct a survey during a town hall meeting.
Use a random digit dialing technique to conduct phone surveys with a representative sample of residents.
Distribute surveys to town residents who attend the next public festivity.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: C because using random digit dialing allows for a sample that is inclusive of residents with varying schedules and interests, likely representing the broader opinion.

questions.question: A college is interested in the post-graduation employment status of its alumni. Which method would provide the most reliable data?
options: Tracking the employment status of alumni who were on the honor roll.
Using social media statuses of alumni who publicly post about their jobs.
Sending an employment survey to a random sample of alumni and using the collected data.
Discussing with the faculty about the employment status of former students they maintain contact with.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: C because sending a survey to a random sample of alumni minimizes selection bias and should yield more accurate generalized conclusions.

questions.question: A health organization wants to estimate the average calorie intake of teenagers. Which approach will most likely minimize sampling bias?
options: Surveying teenagers at a local gym.
Collecting one-day food diaries from a random sample of teenagers across several schools.
Asking parents to estimate their teenagers' calorie intake.
Using nutritional information from fast food restaurants most frequented by teenagers.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: B because collecting food diaries from a random sample allows for a broader representation of different eating habits among teenagers.

questions.question: A researcher wishes to study the exercise habits of adults in a large city. Which method would yield data that is the least biased and most accurate?
options: Observing adults at a popular city park on a weekend.
Surveying only adults who are members of a city-run fitness program.
Using a cluster sampling method to survey adults in various residential blocks throughout the city.
Interviewing a volunteer sample of adults attending a health fair.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: C because cluster sampling across different residential blocks will allow for a diverse cross-section of the city's adult population and their exercise habits.

questions.question: A business analyst wants to understand why certain products are returned more frequently than others. What is the most effective method to obtain valid data?
options: Surveying customers who have returned products within the last month.
Interviewing the sales team for their opinions on product quality.
Analyzing return data for the entire past year, categorizing returns by product and reason provided.
Reviewing only returns made during the holiday season to predict trends.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: C because analyzing comprehensive return data for a significant period provides an objective and quantifiable method to understand return patterns and reasons.

questions.question: A city's department of transportation wants to assess the average commute time for workers during peak hours. Which of the following data collection methods would produce the most reliable information?
options: Questioning workers as they enter the downtown area via public transport during rush hour.
Gathering GPS-based travel time data from a random sample of vehicles during peak commute times.
Interviewing workers at a local coffee shop about their commute times.
Relying on self-reported commute times posted on social media by residents.
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: B because gathering GPS-based data helps in capturing real-time, unbiased travel times of a random sample of vehicles, thus providing a more accurate measure of commute times.
